ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: We started our journey with 3 vocational training center in Munshirhat Ghoradah and Chunavati for empowering women and youth specially who are out of school for long time and due age they are not interested to back in school so we engaged them in this Vocational Training Centers through making soft toys,jute,Zari work etc. This year we also added some extra training like Mushroom farming and Vermi Composting. We also conducted AIDS awareness program under Howrah Network of People Living With in Chunavati Panchpara targeting the youth, Rickshaw puller, truck drivers, and couple who are engaged in daily work We run a formal school in Our organization realize the root of this problem and we try to overcome from it with our limited efforts so, we distributed many books, copy, pen etc throughout this financial year and we give some support to school out children like school admission fees and coaching support to very poor students of our Chunavati Community. Some of them passed from school with good results. Munshirhat one of our target areas is a remote village where huge numbers of people are earning from farming & here we introduced SRI farming for upgrading their farming experiences. SRI farming is a newly developed technology of farming of rice-with this technology farmers grows more than 3 times rice from one seed and it is cheep also. We provide training to farmers of Munshirhat to adopt this technology and distributed SRI seeds for experiment with the help of Ambuja Cement Foundation, and we got good result from it. Treatment Camp in Sultanpur a village of Howrah, besides Andul road where maximum number of population living in Below Poverty Line and they struggling for their livelihood needs, our organization given the responsibilities to one of the renown medical team of Disha Eye Care hospital. Success Story Tamanna Khatun is very progressive in education but due to financial condition she stopped her education when she was in class VII. Her father is a rickshaw puller so education is luxury for her family but after one year Tamanna inform us and we again admitted her in school and also provide education materials, necessary support for education this year she passed with good result and stand in her class

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: HOWRAH SOUTH POINT was founded in 1976 by a French Father to help handicapped children from the slums and provide a medical support to the most deprived in Howrah, the industrial suburb of Calcutta. Over the years the association has responded to the various and urgent needs of the poor people from Howrah, Calcutta and the Northern part of West Bengal. Today, Howrah South Point is completely run by Indian administrators and social workers. Its activities are divided into 4 main programmes: -Rehabilitation of the Handicapped -Health Care -Education For The Deprived, and -Housing For The Poor Besides those main projects, 4 other programmes are run to help the aged and destitute people, to respond to the S.O.S. calls of distressed populations of West Bengal during floods or cyclones, or to provide money to HSP. For HSP, those 26 years of existence have been a fruitful co-operation with local institutions, other NGOâ€™s, government instances, foreign donors and many well wishers. Today the organisation runs 3 formal schools, 3 non-formal schools and 3 special schools with a total strength of about 2010 students. At present we are running 8 Homes in 2 districts of West Bengal. We also run Vocational Trainings, Day Centre, Orthopaedic Workshop and a Restaurant called Aaram Kutir.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: HSB EDUCATION TRUST is trust registered under the India Trust Act, 1882 The Trust is formed on 29RD AUGUST 2011 having its own registered office at HSB House , Rabindra Palli Near Red Cross Suri Birbhum WB 731101 has started its operation during the year 2011 The Mission of the Trust is to promote advance and encourage and or aid in helping promoting advancing and encouraging primary secondary and higher education including technical and vocational skills and empowering the target group with knowledge and skill across various sectors also physical training training of handicrafts fine art and other useful arts crafts among the public including the establishment and maintenance of shilpa shikshalayas kala kendras and other welfare centres for them The Strategic Objectives of the Trust includes establishing various Educational Technical and Vocational Institutions Skill Training Centers etc and operating such institutions or centers with desired outcome for the benefit of the target group without any profit motive Income Tax Department has been pleased to issue 80G & 12A Certificate to the Trust keeping into notice the charitable activities of the trust since its inception Institutes and Training Centers running under the umbrella of HSB Education Trust HSB Polytechnic, Approved by AICTE & affiliated to WBSCTandVEandSD since year 2013 offering Diploma courses in Civil Electrical and Mechanical Engineering in two shifts with gross intake capacity 264 every year including lateral entry students The Institutes has separate boys & girls hostels HSB Private ITI since year 2015 accredited by QCI and Affiliated by DGET offering CTS courses leading to NTC from NCVT in Fitter Electrician and Welder Trades with a gross seating capacity of 146 students HSB Polytechnic Vocational Training Provider started MES course since 2014 with certification from DGET Already it has trained 185 trainees in various courses Running Vocational Training Centers since year 2012 carried out activities for imparting skills related to employability and entrepreneurship training offering Short Term Skill Training courses in different towns and villages Thus today HSB Education Trust has developed sturdy organizational competencies in the field of Technical and Vocational Education and Skill Training with a highly motivated and dedicated team of skilled personnel and ready to accept any challenge in the domain to realize its mission

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: 1. Integrated Slum Community Development Project, We are running integrated community development in 4 locations along the railway lines where people are living at utmost miserable conditions. We provide them safe drinking water, cultural and educational support to the children and health and life style training to the mothers along with economic empowerment through self help group. 1. Cultural Development of children The following four components were regularly organized to achieve the above goals: a) Brotochary 6 days in a week b) Dance Class every Saturday c) Exposure visit d) Drama class 2. Education: a) Running 8 tutorials consisting of 800 students for BPL families b) Running 2 schools. One from class I to class VIII & another from Class I to IV c) Educational sponsorship for 150 students of BPL families 3. Health Promotion: Promotion of immunization, low cost nutrition , Eco-toilets, Family welfare services, Pre and post maternal care. Medication under DOTs & IEC services to control tuberculosis. ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: 1. Running one nonformula school 40 in each at baidyabati areas in Hogghly district. Beside education education student are also provided nutritious food medical support and skill development training. 20of total stdent has been enrolled in nearby Govt. school every year. 2. ISWOI successfully trained 15 adolescent girl on beautician trade in which eight trained girls have already got job oppertunity at local perlors. Supported by ICDS cell Bhatpara municipality 3. The organization basically to ensure basic health education and other common rights at five different Brick kilns at Nilgange area of (N) 24 pgs. 4. ISWOI has completed a vocational training course on Knitting & Embroidery trade with 50 adiliscent girls in which 22 well trained have got employment oppertunity through this initiatives. 5. ISWOI time to time organized awareness camp on women & Child rights including Marraig rights & devorce Women exploitation & service Mechanism to prevent women harassement. 6. ISWOI actively involved to raise awareness on Climate change and impact of Golbal warming and protection of Natural Envioronment in collaboration with Ministry of forest Govt of India. 7. The organization time to time organized Awareness camps on different vital issues like HIV & AIDS pulse polio Immunisation consumer rights etc. 8. One charitable Homoeo clinic is running for local poor people by organization won initiative. 9. ISWOI was organized ten days awareness generation programme with perticipation of 30 women labour to ensure their basic rights and raise awarenees about different vital issues related to their daily life. 10. ISWOI generally coordinates yearly sports & cultural program where the local children youths encourage to perticipate in different sports event & cultural activities. 11. ISWOI is also running a computer training centre on Basic DTP F.A course with 200 student. Beside it organization also running a vocational training school on Wool Knitting trade with 35 local adiliscent to ensure Self reliant of the local Youths.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: 1. We support to remain healthy mentally, by various Art forms. 2. We support to remain healthy through Dance and Yoga. 3. Providing Support to heal through Music. 4.Providing Support to express oneself through Art. 5.Various Arts and Crafts are taught and children and women from poor families are given chance to sell them in various gatherings. 6.Through Music and Dance, therapeutic treatments are provided to special children. Medical Camps are Arranged for awaering people on important topics.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Jagacha Aikatan conducts several program every year along with its Annual Function and Swami Haridas Sangeet Sammelan Kolkata. It conducts regular classes of several Cultural Departments and give chance to the students in performing and bettering their skills. The institute will more often be able to help the people culturally and to be economically independent only if it gets support of financial assistance. It wishes to spread Indian Culture and also to make an incoming way for the students.

The institute has asked for the financial assistance so that it can help the students and the society in bettering their skills which will help them to gain economic independence along with promotion of Indian Art and Culture. Jagacha AIkatan conducts several programs along with the Annual Function and "Swami Haridas Sangeet Sammelan" Kolkata every year for promotion of the Artistes and students. The Institute has always helped the disadvantaged people of the society and women.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: our society also register under PwD Act-1995. Our activity: Swapnatoran ( Handicraft Institute for Physically Challenged):- Presently 25 deaf & dumb person are taking training of making handicraft products at the house of the Secretary of the Society and which fully free and also without Aid of any of the Govt. and/or Pvt. Sectors in any manner whatsoever. Titir S.H.G (A Grpup Of Physically Challenged.) The manufactured products of Swapnatoran Welfare Society are being sold by this self help group (A Group of physically challenged. Reg. no.EM/II/1900211824).in various fair and by this act the accumulated fund use to distribute amogst these people towards their act of creation and also to boost up themselves. Artisans identity Card Creation: Our society provides training to these specially abled people to make them technical in the field of handicraft and also sees to it that they are being recognized by the DC Handicraft(Ministry of Textie), Small Scale Industries, Govt. of India and till date 8 of them are being recognized by the Govt. of India and all of them were handed over their applicable identity card for their future. Open Education Centre: The foremost impedoment for the deaf & dumb is their short off words which is why they are being provided with special education system which takes place everyday from 3 p.m. to 4 p.m. Educational voyage:- To impart practical application of life, every Sunday These people are being taken out to various places, such as Station, Market, Park, Ashram etc. to increase their stock of word and expression. Free Educational Centre:- Through this all the other specially abled people of the society are being given free education. Presently only 5 no. of these students could be provided with this facility. Free Repairing of Hearing Aid:- The hearing impaired people are being provided with their hearing aid and at times the society also gets the hearing aid repaired for these people free of cost. Information Regarding Various Schemes run by the Govornment:- Our Society also assists these specially abled people by providing necessary information regarding how to get proper identity card, and als how to go forward to get other assistance from the Govt. authorities from time to time. Discussion Forum with Parents:- Our Society also arrange meeting with the parents of these specially abled peopleon every last Sunday of every month where the entire facts regarding the health, mental fitness and other facts are being discussed. In this year our society awarded by state govt. of west bengal in the category of outstanding institution for its endeavor to train the person with disabilities in handicrafts & cottage industries and make them self-employed. we runing our work with out any govt.& non govt. fund. for better work we want grant.
